chapter.17.quest.96.subtitle: This is a lot, I know.
chapter.17.quest.96.task.1.title: Tier 4 Ore Processing Factory
chapter.17.quest.97.description.1:
Standing on this item will charge up any powered item from any mod.


This is also needed for the Robit.
chapter.17.title: Mekanism
chapter.18.quest.1.description.1:
Thermal Series is a modular series of mods that add a content-rich blend of magic and technology to your Minecraft experience!


A lot of the machines provide a basic function, with easy upgrades.
chapter.18.quest.1.subtitle: And Also Thermal Series!
chapter.18.quest.1.task.1.title: Thermal Expansion!
chapter.18.quest.10.subtitle: Generates Power using Enchanted Items!
chapter.18.quest.11.subtitle: Generates Power using Food?
chapter.18.quest.12.description.1:
This is a base upgrade for all machines and items.


Note: While you can put several base upgrades into a machine, only the highest tier takes effect.
chapter.18.quest.12.subtitle: Tier 1 Base Upgrade
chapter.18.quest.13.description.1:
This is a tier 2 upgrade for Thermal Series items and machines.


Note: While you can put several base upgrades into a machine, only the highest tier takes effect.
chapter.18.quest.13.subtitle: Tier 2 Base Upgrade
chapter.18.quest.14.description.1:
This is the highest base tier upgrade for Thermal Series items and machines.


Note: While you can put several base upgrades into a machine, only the highest tier takes effect.
chapter.18.quest.14.subtitle: Tier 3 Base Upgrade
chapter.18.quest.15.description.1: Creates an infinite water source when placed between two water source blocks.
chapter.18.quest.16.description.1: This machine charges the items placed inside.
chapter.18.quest.16.subtitle: Charges Items
chapter.18.quest.17.description.1:
This machine can produce several types of stone.


Place 1 lava source block on one side, and 1 water source block on the other, and it will generate cobblestone. Check the recipes to see the other kinds of stone you can create!
chapter.18.quest.17.subtitle: A Cobblestone Generator
chapter.18.quest.18.description.1:
Can convert certain blocks into liquids.


This is useful for generating lava from Cobblestone, Netherrack, etc.
chapter.18.quest.19.description.1:
This machine works like a Botany Pot, Garden Cloche, etc.


When given water and a seed, it will grow the seed inside of the machine and auto-output the products into the machine.
chapter.18.quest.2.description.1:
The Redstone Furnace uses RF/FE instead of Coal to smelt items.


Like all machines in the Thermal Series, this machine can be upgraded with augments to increase the speed of each process.
chapter.18.quest.2.subtitle: Powered Furnace
chapter.18.quest.2.title: The Redstone Furnace
chapter.18.quest.21.subtitle: Vacuums up items
chapter.18.quest.22.description.1: Spreads Potion Effects to an area.
chapter.18.quest.23.description.1: Can be used to charge items, augment machines, or fill up items with liquid.
chapter.18.quest.24.title: Storing Power
chapter.18.quest.25.title: Storing Fluids
chapter.18.quest.26.subtitle: Allows Storage of XP
chapter.18.quest.27.subtitle: Increases RF Capacity and Transfer Rate x4
chapter.18.quest.28.subtitle: Increases RF Capacity 6x, RF Transfer 2x
chapter.18.quest.29.subtitle: Increases RF Transfer 6x, Capacity 2x
chapter.18.quest.3.description.1: The Pulverizer breaks raw ores into dusts, and also has a 25% chance to create an extra dust.
chapter.18.quest.3.subtitle: Breaks Ores into Dusts
chapter.18.quest.30.subtitle: Increases Tank Storage 4x
chapter.18.quest.32.subtitle: Increases Processing Speed, but Reduces Efficiency
chapter.18.quest.33.subtitle: Increases Efficiency at the cost of Speed
chapter.18.quest.34.subtitle: Increases Secondary Output
chapter.18.quest.35.subtitle: Reduces Catalyst Usage
chapter.18.quest.36.subtitle: Voids By-products
chapter.18.quest.37.subtitle: Increases Generation Rate at Cost of Efficiency
chapter.18.quest.38.subtitle: Increases Fuel Efficiency of Dynamos
chapter.18.quest.39.subtitle: Increases AoE Effect +1
chapter.18.quest.4.description.1:
The Induction Furnace combines materials into new alloys.


This is also useful when smelting Ancient Debris into Netherite Scraps.
chapter.18.quest.4.subtitle: The Alloy Maker
chapter.18.quest.40.subtitle: Amplifies Potion Effect
chapter.18.quest.41.subtitle: Increases Duration of Potion Effect
chapter.18.quest.42.description.1:
Don't get too excited.


This mostly only works for extracting dyes from flowers, or ore blends back into their components.
chapter.18.quest.42.subtitle: Separates Items into their Crafting Components
chapter.18.quest.43.description.1:
Creates "Presses" using Casts.


Think plates, gears, etc.
chapter.18.quest.44.description.1:
Converts items from a liquid to a solid, some requiring casts.


There is also a bee spawn egg recipe it can create.
chapter.18.quest.45.description.1: Can convert liquids into items or other useful liquids.
chapter.18.quest.46.description.1:
Works like a Coke Oven, but simplified.


Insert "fuel" like Coal and it'll produce Coal Coke and a by-product.
chapter.18.quest.48.description.1: Can Create "Liquid" Potions that can be bottled into Potions.
chapter.18.quest.49.subtitle: An Auto-Crafter!
chapter.18.quest.5.description.1: The Machine Frame is needed to craft various machines in Thermal Series.
chapter.18.quest.5.subtitle: The Basic Frame for Machines
chapter.18.quest.50.description.1: It's more like a pickaxe that uses RF/FE.
chapter.18.quest.50.subtitle: An Early-Game Mining Gadget
chapter.18.quest.51.subtitle: RF-Powered Handsaw!
chapter.18.quest.6.subtitle: Generates Power by Burning Items!
chapter.18.quest.7.description.1: Note: This accepts Tree Oil, Creosote Oil, and Refined Fuel.
chapter.18.quest.7.subtitle: Generates Power using Liquid Fuel!
chapter.18.quest.8.subtitle: Generates Power using Lava!
chapter.18.quest.9.subtitle: Generates Power using Gems!
chapter.18.title: Thermal Series
chapter.19.quest.1.description.1:
Welcome to &aArs Nouveau&f!


Ars Nouveau is a magic mod that allows you to create custom spells with the different Glyphs made within the mod!
chapter.19.quest.1.task.1.title: Ars Nouveau
chapter.19.quest.100.description.1:
To gain further knowledge of spells, we'll need a specific type of magical wood!


Unlike ATM6, Archwood Trees can be found in the overworld.
chapter.19.quest.100.task.1.title: Archwood Logs
chapter.19.quest.100.task.2.title: Archwood Planks
chapter.19.quest.100.title: Archwood logs
chapter.19.quest.101.description.1:
In Ars Nouveau, the power system for machines is called &9Source&r.


To start collecting some Source, we'll need a Source Jar.


Source can also be moved with buckets, or by breaking and picking up Source Jars.
chapter.19.quest.101.subtitle: Storing Source
chapter.19.quest.104.description.1:
Using our Enchanting Apparatus structure, we'll want to craft our first seed, the &5Magebloom Seed&r.


This will be used to create us some magical clothing!
chapter.19.quest.104.subtitle: Growing Magic
chapter.19.quest.104.title: Magebloom Seed
chapter.19.quest.108.description.1:
The Volcanic Sourcelink generates Source by consuming burnable items. Archwood logs will generate bonus Source.


As it burns items, it will convert nearby stone into lava.


This also generates Lava Lilys.
chapter.19.quest.109.description.1:
Runic Chalk is used to draw permanent Runes on that ground. These runes will cast spells on entities that walk over them.


To attach a spell to a rune, inscribe a &eSpell Parchment&r using a Scribe's Table.


Note: The Rune will need Source to operate.
chapter.19.quest.109.subtitle: Placeable Spells
chapter.19.quest.125.description.1:
While holding your Spellbook, you can press C to open up the spell creation page.


Each spell must have a form. You start off with 3 basic forms: Projectile, Self-cast, and Touch.


For the Effect, this determines what happens when you cast the spell. You can have up to 9 effects per spell.


For starters, you have Harm and Break.


Select one Form and one Effect, name your spell, and click create!
chapter.19.quest.125.task.1.title: Creating Your First Spell
chapter.19.quest.126.description.1:
In the bottom left of your screen, you'll see a bar. This bar is your mana pool!


There are several ways to increase your mana pool, or increase the efficiency of your spells as you progress through the mod. Upgrading your spellbook can also increase your mana!
chapter.19.quest.126.subtitle: Mage Power
chapter.19.quest.126.task.1.title: Mana
chapter.19.quest.127.description.1: To create Source Gems, we'll need to put either Lapis or Amethyst Shards into the Imbuement Chamber. Over time, these will convert to Source Gems!
chapter.19.quest.127.title: &5Source Gems
chapter.19.quest.128.description.1:
The &6Dowsing Rod&r gives you Magic Find and Scrying when used.


This allows you to see nearby magic creatures as well as helping you find amethyst!
chapter.19.quest.128.subtitle: Magic Finder
chapter.19.quest.129.subtitle: Generates Source from Mob Deaths and Animal Breeding
chapter.19.quest.130.description.1:
The &9Alchemical Sourcelink&r produces Source from adjacent potion jars.


The amount of source varies per potion and complexity.
chapter.19.quest.130.subtitle: Power through Potions
chapter.19.quest.131.description.1:
Source Berries produce more Source than other sources.


This will also convert grass or dirt into Mycelium in a 3x3 area around it. It will also grow mushrooms around it if the space is empty.
chapter.19.quest.131.subtitle: Generates Source from Nearby Food
chapter.19.quest.132.description.1:
Placing this near growing plants or saplings will provide Source. Archwood trees provide more Source!


Note: Bonemealing does not produce Source.
chapter.19.quest.132.subtitle: Creates Source using the growth of Plants
chapter.19.quest.133.description.1: With Source Gems, you can get started crafting the various machines by creating &5Arcane Stones&r.
chapter.19.quest.133.subtitle: Magical Rocks
chapter.19.quest.133.title: Arcane Stone
chapter.19.quest.134.description.1: Used to inscribe spells on with the Scribe's Table.
chapter.19.quest.135.description.1: The Dominion Wand is used for controlling the creatures you might encounter in the world! Each being responds differently to the wand, so make sure to read up in the Worn Notebook!
chapter.19.quest.135.title: Summoning Help!
chapter.19.quest.136.description.1:
The &9Enchanter's Sword&r allows you to attach a Touch Spell to the sword. 


All spells on the Sword gain 1 additional Amplify augment to the last effect on the spell.


To apply a spell to the sword, use a Scribe's Table. Create the spell without using a form.
chapter.19.quest.137.description.1:
When blocking damage, the &9Enchanter's Shield&r will give the user Mana Regen and Spell Damage for a short amount of time.


Additionally, the shield will repair itself over time using the wearer's mana.
chapter.19.quest.138.description.1:
The &9Enchanter's Mirror&r will apply a self spell when used.


Spells cast with this mirror are discounted and gain additional bonus duration.


To apply a spell, use a Scribe's table. Create a spell without using a form.
chapter.19.quest.139.description.1:
This bow can be inscribed with a spell using a Scribe's Table.


At the cost of mana, arrows will become Spell Arrows and will apply the spell on their target.


If you have no arrows, a spell arrow that deals 0 damage will be cast. If there is not enough mana, regular arrows will be fired instead.


The &9Enchanter's Bow&r can also use special Augment Arrows that empower the inscribed spell.
chapter.19.quest.140.description.1:
The &9Jar of Light&r summons a floating light source that follows you.


The &6Jar of Voiding&r destroys items you pick up in exchange for mana. This can be filtered.


To add or remove an item to be detroyed by the jar, use the jar with the item in your off hand, or use an item on the Scribe's Table with the jar placed on it.


The jar must be on your hotbar to function.
chapter.19.quest.141.description.1: The Ring of Discount provides a small bonus to max mana and mana regen. It also reduces the total cost to cast a spell.
chapter.19.quest.142.description.1: This belt will give random positive potion effects for a short duration. These will vary in strength.
chapter.19.quest.143.description.1:
Have you ever wanted to just hover everywhere you go?


This belt allows you to levitate. To activate, just sneak while in the air, either while falling or from jumping.
chapter.19.quest.144.description.1:
The &9Amulet of Mana Boost&r gives a boost to max mana.


The &6Amulet of Mana Regen&r gives a boost to your mana regen.
chapter.19.quest.144.title: The Amulets
chapter.19.quest.145.description.1:
The &9Caster's Wand&r only accepts a single spell, and is inscribed using the Scribe's Table.


Wand spells always start with Projectile > Accelerate, and MUST be inscribed with a spell that does not have another method (like touch, self, etc).


This allows you to cast spells beyond the 10 spell cap. If you want to use Break, just inscribe the wand with Break by itself.
chapter.19.quest.69.description.1:
Tier 2 Glyphs require 5 levels of experience to be made.


They also require a &9Mage's Spell Book&r to create.
chapter.19.quest.69.title: Tier 2 Glyphs
chapter.19.quest.70.description.1: Tier 1 Glyphs require 3 levels of experience to be made.
chapter.19.quest.70.title: Tier 1 Glyphs
chapter.19.quest.71.description.1:
Tier 3 Glyphs require 10 levels of experience to be made.


They also require an &6Archmage's Spell Book&r.
chapter.19.quest.71.title: Tier 3 Glyphs
chapter.19.quest.72.description.1:
When your Magebloom seeds.... bloom, you can use the Magebloom to create Fibers.


These are used to craft several items, including your first set of magical armor, the &eNovice Armor&r.
chapter.19.quest.73.description.1:
Infusing Magebloom Fiber with Blaze Powder makes it even stronger!


These are used to create the Mage Armor.
chapter.19.quest.74.description.1:
Unlike Skyrim, you don't have to cast a single spell to become the Archmage.


If we infuse our Blaze Fibers with Chorus Fruit, we'll get &5End Fibers&r.


These are used to craft the &6Archmage Armor&r.
chapter.19.quest.74.subtitle: Becoming the Archmage
chapter.19.quest.75.description.1:
The &9Enchanting Apparatus&r is used to craft various items within the mod. It requires Source to work.


It is also a multiblock structure that utilizes Arcane Pedestals to craft.


Start by placing an Arcane Core in the ground, then place the Enchanting Apparatus on top of it. Surround the Apparatus with Arcane Pedestals, like shown in the image.
chapter.19.quest.75.title: Enchanting Apparatus
chapter.19.quest.76.description.1:
Arcane Pedestals are needed for the Ritual Brazier and crafting items with an Enchanting Apparatus.


Go ahead and make yourself 8 of them!
chapter.19.quest.76.subtitle: Fancy Tables
chapter.19.quest.76.title: Arcane Pedestals
chapter.19.quest.92.description.1:
If you want to cast better spells, you'll need a &6Scribe's Table&r to unlock new glyphs for your spellbook.


There are 3 tiers of glyphs to unlock, and each one requires some experience and items.


The Scribe's Table is also used to attach spells to Spell Parchments. To do this, place a Spell Parchment on the table, select the spell in your Spellbook, then sneak right-click the book on the table.


To create a Glyph, right-click on the Scribe's Table with your spellbook. Search for the glyph you want to make, then click Select at the bottom. Right-click the table with the items required, and the glyph will be created. Use the glyph to learn it.


Note: The table can pull items from nearby inventories.
chapter.19.quest.92.reward.1.title: Random Tier 1 Glyph
chapter.19.quest.92.subtitle: Upgrading Spells
chapter.19.quest.94.description.1:
To get started, you'll need to craft yourself a &6Novice Spellbook&r.


This is where you create and store your spells.


Hitting the &9C&r key will open up the "Create a Spell" page. On the left, there are several tabs, but the main 3 are: Spell Creation, Color Picker, and Familiars.


This spellbook will only allow you to create and use Tier 1 Glyphs. To create better spells, you'll need to upgrade your Spellbook!
chapter.19.quest.94.subtitle: Our First Spellbook
chapter.19.quest.95.description.1:
This is the next upgrade to your Spellbook!


This will increase your overall mana and mana regen, as well as unlocking the ability to create and use Tier 2 Glyphs.
chapter.19.quest.95.reward.1.title: Random Tier 1 Glyph
chapter.19.quest.96.description.1:
To create the final tier of your Spellbook, you'll need to have killed the &6Wilden Chimera&r.


This is a Ritual that you'll need to complete using a &9Ritual Brazier&r.
chapter.19.quest.97.description.1:
The &9Ritual Brazier&r is used to cast rituals. It can also be used for decoration. If you want to light the Brazier, use a Light spell on it.


To perform rituals, you'll need Arcane Pedestals as well. As there are so many rituals to cast, make sure to check out each of them using the &6Worn Notebook&r!


This can be done by holding Ctrl on the Ritual Table while the book is in your inventory.
chapter.19.quest.98.description.1:
The &9Potion Jar&r stores up to 100 potions. You can remove them by using an empty bottle or a potion flask on the jar.


Wixies will use these jars during Potion Autocrafting.
chapter.19.quest.98.subtitle: Storing Potions
chapter.19.quest.99.description.1:
To create one of the main crafting items in Ars, the &9Source Gem&r, we'll need to make an &6Imbuement Chamber&r.


The Imbuement Chamber requires Source to imbue items. It produces a small amount of Source by itself, but can also use Source Jars as a power source.


Several recipes also require Arcane Pedestals to be placed around it as well.
chapter.19.quest.99.subtitle: Creating Source Gems
chapter.19.title: Ars Nouveau
chapter.2.quest.1.description.1: 可以在山地生態域中的洞穴屋頂及牆壁上找到，尤其在山峰超過 Y170 的地方特別多。
chapter.2.quest.1.task.1.title: ATM 金屬礦
chapter.2.quest.1.title: ATM 金屬礦
chapter.2.quest.11.description.1: 現在你只是在炫耀而已。
chapter.2.quest.12.description.1: 在這階段幾乎是作弊了。
chapter.2.quest.12.task.1.title: Charm of AllthemodiumSight
chapter.2.quest.13.description.1: 我的媽呀這東西比我想得還常見。
chapter.2.quest.13.task.1.title: Charm of VibraniumSight
chapter.2.quest.14.task.1.title: Charm of UnobtainiumSight
chapter.2.quest.2.description.1: 在地獄的扭曲森林和緋紅森林中的 Y100 至 Y123 之間找到這礦物，或在異獄的 Y0 至 Y20 。
chapter.2.quest.2.task.1.title: 汎金屬礦
chapter.2.quest.3.description.1: 可以在終界城中取得這個礦物。
chapter.2.quest.37.description.1:
很久很久以前，龍族生活在這些地方。


異獄那裡不再有龍了，不過現在富含汎金屬。
chapter.2.quest.37.title: 豬布林家園
chapter.2.quest.5.description.1: It is recommended to craft this potion with your first ingot.
chapter.2.quest.5.task.1.title: AllthemodiumSight
chapter.2.quest.7.task.1.title: VibraniumSight
chapter.2.quest.8.task.1.title: UnobtainiumSight
chapter.2.quest.9.description.1: 能力愈強… 伴隨某種東西就是。
chapter.2.title: ATM 金屬
chapter.20.quest.1.task.1.title: Botania
chapter.20.quest.1.title: Botania
chapter.20.quest.11.description.1: These two items will allow you to cart around manapools to bring to your &aBotania &fdevices.
chapter.20.quest.11.title: Mobile Mana
chapter.20.quest.2.description.1: The &ePetal Apothecary&f will allow you to make all of the Generating and Functional Flowers you need.
chapter.20.quest.2.title: Petal Apothecary
chapter.20.quest.3.description.1: This flower will help you make the basic materials that are widely used in &aBotania
chapter.20.quest.43.description.1: This unfortunately does not have a factory version yet.
chapter.20.quest.47.title: Portable Mana
chapter.20.quest.5.description.1: An early-game way of taking &bmana &ffrom flowers and pools to sending to other pools or devices.
chapter.20.quest.55.title: Mana Manipulation
chapter.20.quest.57.description.1: The &eFloral Fertilizer&f can be used to grow more &eMystical Flowers&f, similar to bonemeal growing grass.
chapter.20.quest.57.title: Got Flowers?
chapter.20.quest.60.title: Corporeal Network
chapter.20.quest.63.description.1: Obtained by using a bottle in the End
chapter.20.quest.7.description.1: This flower is capable of converting other materials, check JEI for more info.
chapter.20.quest.9.description.1: The main tool of &aBotania&f, will be used throughout the entire mod.
chapter.20.title: Botania
chapter.21.quest.1.description.1:
Forbidden \&\ Arcanus adds new ways to get better armor, enchants, and more!


This magic-themed mod has amazing animations, as well as some overpowered items like the &6Eternal Stella&r.
chapter.21.quest.1.task.1.title: Welcome to Forbidden \&\ Arcanus!
chapter.21.quest.1.title: Welcome to &5Forbidden \&\ Arcanus!
chapter.21.quest.10.description.1: Breaking spawners will now drop &9Spawner Scraps&r.
chapter.21.quest.11.description.1: The &9Quantum Catcher&r is used to capture and transport mobs.
chapter.21.quest.11.title: Entity Tools
chapter.21.quest.12.description.1:
Found randomly in loot chests from the End City.


When used, it grants 5 minutes of creative flight.
chapter.21.quest.13.description.1: This gives X-Ray vision for mobs, highlighting them from afar to make it easier to spot them.
chapter.21.quest.13.subtitle: Highlights Mobs when Activated
chapter.21.quest.14.description.1:
Using this bone meal on Farmland will convert it to Magical Farmland.


Crops will produce double the output when grown on Magical Farmland.
chapter.21.quest.14.subtitle: Use on Farmland to make it Magical!
chapter.21.quest.15.subtitle: Can Infect Villagers and Horses
chapter.21.quest.16.subtitle: Arrow Go Boom
chapter.21.quest.17.subtitle: Leaves an AoE Cloud that damages living mobs
chapter.21.quest.18.description.1:
These can be planted to grow Arcane Gold Nuggets.


To create one, you'll need to find Yellow Orchids.
chapter.21.quest.18.subtitle: Growing Gold
chapter.21.quest.19.description.1:
Crafted with skulls, bones, and cloth, this armor is slightly stronger than Iron.


It's also really cool looking.
chapter.21.quest.19.subtitle: Armor of the Dead
chapter.21.quest.19.title: Mortem Armor
chapter.21.quest.2.description.1:
Found within the Dark Forest biome, the Edelwood Tree looks like a small tree that has been chopped in half.


You'll need to break the branches off and collect the logs, as these are used for crafting various items within the mod.


With no natural generation to be found. These saplings can be bought from the Market
chapter.21.quest.2.title: Edelwood Trees
chapter.21.quest.20.description.1: &6Arcane Gold&r can be used to craft armor, which is stronger than Diamonds!
chapter.21.quest.20.subtitle: Oooo....Shiny
chapter.21.quest.20.title: &6Arcane Gold Armor
chapter.21.quest.21.title: &6Arcane Golden Sword
chapter.21.quest.22.title: &6Arcane Golden Tools
chapter.21.quest.23.description.1: Combining a Dragon Head with a Mystical Dagger will give you &9Dragon Scales&r.
chapter.21.quest.23.subtitle: Dragon Scales, Dragon Scales.....
chapter.21.quest.23.title: Dragon Scales
chapter.21.quest.24.subtitle: Better than Netherite
chapter.21.quest.24.title: &1Draco Arcanus Armor&r
chapter.21.quest.25.description.1:
The Dragon Scale can be made into a Golden and Aquatic Dragon Scales.


These are mainly used to craft &dTyr Armor&r. It is also needed in the ATM Star recipe.
chapter.21.quest.26.description.1:
Used to corrupt Souls and Runes. You'll need this for later.


If you throw down Dark Matter, then throw down Corrupti Dust, it'll create a Black Hole. Feed it small entities like Arrows or Experience Orbs, and it'll produce Xpetrified Orbs.
chapter.21.quest.27.description.1:
Using our Arcane Crystal Dust, we'll need to combine it with other dusts and powders to create Mundabiter Dust.


This dust is used in several recipes, as well as activating the Hephaestus Forge.
chapter.21.quest.27.subtitle: Let the Dusts Combine
chapter.21.quest.27.title: Mundabitur Dust
chapter.21.quest.28.description.1:
The &6Arcane Gold Ingot&r is needed to continue your progression in the mod.


It's used for a lot of stuff, and it's also pretty.
chapter.21.quest.28.title: &6Arcane Gold Ingots
chapter.21.quest.29.title: &5Tyr Armor
chapter.21.quest.3.subtitle: A Silk-Touch Pickaxe
chapter.21.quest.30.description.1:
To create the &6ATM Star&r, you'll need several items from Forbidden and Arcanus.


You'll need a Dark Soul, a Golden Dragon Scale, and an Arcane Dragon Egg.
chapter.21.quest.30.task.1.title: Dragon Soul
chapter.21.quest.31.description.1:
This Dragon Egg is needed for the ATM Star recipe.


It's also a cool decoration piece.
chapter.21.quest.32.description.1:
Killing passive mobs will increase your corruption. Killing &9Aureal Entities&r has a higher chance to increase your corruption.


Be careful! At higher levels of corruption, negative things will happen!


Making a Sanity Meter will give your UI an upgrade to show your total corruption, for those who want to hit new high scores and such.
chapter.21.quest.32.subtitle: Am I going insane?
chapter.21.quest.32.title: Sanity
chapter.21.quest.33.description.1: You've probably already acquired some Darkstone, but we'll need it to craft the forge.
chapter.21.quest.33.title: Prepping For the Forge
chapter.21.quest.34.description.1:
We'll be using all of that Darkstone to create the &1Hephaestus Forge&r.


Once you have all of the blocks needed, you'll need to build the platform for the forge.


Once built, place a Smithing Table in the center, then sneak+right-click with a piece of Mundabitur Dust.


To see how to build the platform, search in JEI for the forge, then hold W to view the ponder.
chapter.21.quest.34.title: &1The Hephaestus Forge
chapter.21.quest.35.description.1:
The &9Lens of Veritatis&r is used to see Aureal entities.


These are entities that will grant Aureal when killed, but will also increase your corruption....
chapter.21.quest.36.description.1:
Smelting &9Edelwood&r will give you Dark Matter.


You can make Black Holes with this.
chapter.21.quest.37.description.1:
Blood is collected by crafting Test Tubes, then killing mobs with the Mystical Dagger.


Note: The Test Tube must be in your inventory when killing mobs.
chapter.21.quest.37.title: &4Blood
chapter.21.quest.38.description.1:
&dAureal Bottles&r can be found in loot chests, but they can also be crafted using Arcane Crystal Dust.


You can also generate Aureal with Arcane Crystal Obelisks.
chapter.21.quest.38.title: &9Aureal
chapter.21.quest.39.description.1: Souls are gathered by creating a &9Soul Extractor&r, and then using it on Soul Sand.
chapter.21.quest.39.title: &dSouls
chapter.21.quest.4.description.1:
The Mystical Dagger is used to break Dragon Heads down to Dragon Scales.


When killing mobs with it with a test tube in your inventory, it will also collect blood.
chapter.21.quest.40.description.1: This goes in the right side of the forge.
chapter.21.quest.40.subtitle: Experience in a bottle
chapter.21.quest.40.title: &aBottle O' Enchanting
chapter.21.quest.41.description.1:
The Forge requires 4 different items to be powered: Aureal, Souls, Blood, and Experience.


To learn more, follow the corner quests.
chapter.21.quest.41.task.1.title: Powering the Forge
chapter.21.quest.42.description.1:
To enchant items, you'll need Darkstone Pedestals placed around the Forge.


Make sure to place these on the Arcane Chiseled Polished Darkstone.
chapter.21.quest.42.title: Darkstone Pedestals
chapter.21.quest.43.description.1:
To perform a ritual, place the ingredients on the Arcane Pedestals.


You'll need a &9Blacksmith's Gavel&r to activate the ritual. To do this, right click on the Forge with the Gavel.
chapter.21.quest.43.task.1.title: Blacksmith Gavel
chapter.21.quest.43.title: Performing Rituals
chapter.21.quest.44.description.1:
The &6Stella Eternal&r has 3 charges, and when right-clicked, it can fully repair all of your items in your inventory.


The main purpose of this is to give the enchant &9Unbreakable&r to an item, which is done by combining it with the tool in a Smithing Table.
chapter.21.quest.44.title: &dStella Eternal
chapter.21.quest.45.description.1: This item can be combined with a tool to add the &6Fiery&r enchant, which auto-smelts blocks when harvested, or sets things ablaze.
chapter.21.quest.46.description.1:
This stuff is everywhere.


It can be used to give yourself experience, or used to make the Stella Eternal.
chapter.21.quest.47.subtitle: Dragon Tools
chapter.21.quest.47.title: &1Draco Tools
chapter.21.quest.48.description.1: The Scepter shoots out energy orbs when charged up with Right-Click. If a mob is hit, it'll strike it with lightning.
chapter.21.quest.48.subtitle: Go Pew Pew
chapter.21.quest.48.title: &1Draco Weapons
chapter.21.quest.49.description.1:
To create an Arcane Crystal Obelisk, place down an Arcane Polished Darkstone block, then place two Arcane Crystal Blocks on top of it.


Right-click with Mundabitur Dust and you'll create the obelisk.


When placed on a Arcane Chiseled Polished Darkstone block on the Hephaestus Forge structure, it will slowly generate Aureal over time.
chapter.21.quest.49.task.1.title: Arcane Crystal Obelisks
chapter.21.quest.5.description.1:
The Edelwood bucket can store more than one bucket of liquid, and can also be used to capture small animals like chickens or squids.


You'll need the Permafrost enchant to use it to carry Lava.
chapter.21.quest.50.description.1: The Hephaestus Forge is also used for creating Enchants. Check out JEI to see all of the different Enchants you can create!
chapter.21.quest.50.task.1.title: Enchantments
chapter.21.quest.6.description.1: This is the main resource in the mod. Go out and mine some!
chapter.21.quest.6.title: Arcane Crystals
chapter.21.quest.7.description.1:
You'll find the Stella Arcanum ore deep underground.


Careful when mining.
chapter.21.quest.7.subtitle: This Goes Boom Too
chapter.21.quest.8.description.1:
Have you seen the random floating island in the sky? Not the slime one, but the tiny one?


These have the Nipa plant on them. You can break these and relocate them.


They produce Arcane Crystal Dust Specks over time, which can be used to create Arcane Crystal Dust.
chapter.21.quest.8.title: Nipa Plants
chapter.21.quest.9.description.1:
Smelting down Arcane Crystals will give you Arcane Crystal Dust.


This is used for most of the items in the mod.
chapter.21.title: Forbidden and Arcanus
chapter.22.quest.1.description.1:
Welcome to &9Tinkers' Construct!&r


TC is all about creating custom tools and armor by creating individual parts that combine to make bigger and better tools!


It also adds new ways to smelt ores with custom multiblock Smelteries for all of your smelting needs.
chapter.22.quest.1.subtitle: Custom Tools and Armor!
chapter.22.quest.1.task.1.title: Welcome to Tinkers' Construct!
chapter.22.quest.10.description.1:
The pants have low armor and durability, but comes with:


3 Upgrade Slots
2 Defense Slots
1 Ability Slot
chapter.22.quest.11.description.1:
As the rest of the gear, the boots come with low durability and armor, but comes with:


3 Upgrade Slots
2 Defense Slots
1 Ability Slot
chapter.22.quest.12.description.1:
Using the Tinker Station, you can modify your tools.


Modifiers add special stats and abilities to your tools based on the modifier type.


This section explains the types of modifiers!
chapter.22.quest.12.task.1.title: Modifiers
chapter.22.quest.13.description.1:
Traits are abilities or extra stats that are attached to either the type of tool, or the materials the tool was built out of.


To see all of the different kinds of traits, make sure to check out the books &eMaterials and You&r, &eMighty Smelting&r, and &eFantastic Foundry&r.
chapter.22.quest.13.task.1.title: Traits
chapter.22.quest.14.description.1:
Each tool starts with 3 to 4 upgrade slots. These slots can be used to enhance the tool, like adding redstone to increase the speed.


Make sure to check out the book &9Puny Smelting&r to see all of the available upgrades!
chapter.22.quest.14.task.1.title: Tool Upgrade Slots
chapter.22.quest.15.description.1:
Slotless Modifiers do not require a slot to add. You can add as many as you'd like.


These are usually cosmetic.


To see a list of available Slotless Modifiers, check out the book &ePuny Smelting&r.
chapter.22.quest.15.task.1.title: Slotless Modifiers
chapter.22.quest.15.title: Slotless Mods
chapter.22.quest.16.description.1:
Abilities are powerful modifiers, like Silk Touch or Autosmelt.


Abilities require ability slots on the tool, which most tools start with at least one slot. You can only add 1 more ability slot per tool, so choose wisely!


The book &eMighty Smelting&r lists all available abilities that can be placed on tools.
chapter.22.quest.16.task.1.title: Tool Abilities
chapter.22.quest.17.description.1:
These mods are applied to Armor, which gives certain defense abilities like Fire Resistance.


If you're looking to check out all of the available Defense Modifiers, check out the book &eMighty Smelting&r.
chapter.22.quest.17.task.1.title: Defense Mods
chapter.22.quest.18.description.1:
To be able to use metals to create tools, we'll need a smeltery, which is created from &eGrout&r.


To create Grout, you'll need Sand, Gravel, and Clay. Get as much as you can!
chapter.22.quest.18.subtitle: I am Grout.
chapter.22.quest.18.title: Gathering Grout
chapter.22.quest.19.description.1:
&eMaterials and You&r is the starter guide for Tinkers' Construct.


You can also just use the Eccentric Tome that you started with, as it should have this book inside of it.


You might be wondering why you're getting one in return. You'll need it to upgrade the book to the next tier!
chapter.22.quest.19.subtitle: The Starter Guide
chapter.22.quest.2.description.1:
To get started in TC, you'll need to create &ePatterns&r.


These are made out of planks and sticks, so make sure to make plenty of them!


These are used to create the basic tables we'll need to create parts, as well as making tool patterns to create new tools!
chapter.22.quest.2.subtitle: The Basic Pattern
chapter.22.quest.2.title: Patterns
chapter.22.quest.20.description.1: This book will teach you how to make your first setup, the Melter.
chapter.22.quest.21.description.1:
Smelting &eGrout&r will give you &9Seared Bricks&r. Don't confuse these with the block Brick, as those are different.


&9Seared Brick&r is the basic crafting material used to make a smeltery. It never hurts to get as many as you can.
chapter.22.quest.21.title: Throw it in the Furnace
chapter.22.quest.22.description.1:
To create metal tools, we'll need to make a Smeltery to make molten metal.


We're going to make a Melter, which is the first simple smeltery we'll need before we can make our big custom smelteries.


This is how the Melter is setup:
chapter.22.quest.22.title: Your First Smeltery
chapter.22.quest.23.description.1: At the start, you can make Sand Casts to create the tool casts for your first metal parts.
chapter.22.quest.23.title: Single-Use Metal Casts
chapter.22.quest.24.description.1:
If you have the gold, you can make reusable casts by pouring the molten gold over the item you are looking to make a cast out of.


Let's make an Ingot Gold Cast. Place some gold in the Melter to smelt it into Molten Gold, then place an ingot on the Casting Table. Right click on the faucet to pour out the Molten Gold over the ingot, creating us an Ingot Cast.
chapter.22.quest.24.title: Reusable Metal Casts
chapter.22.quest.25.description.1:
Using our Melter, let's smelt down some Copper.


Start by smelting 4 ingots of Copper in the Melter. Then, place a Seared Brick in our Casting Basin.


With the Copper selected in the Melter (left click if you have other molten metals inside), right-click on the faucet to pour out the Molten Copper in the Casting Basin.


This will create our Smeltery Controller.
chapter.22.quest.25.title: Making the Smeltery Controller
chapter.22.quest.26.description.1:
It's time to build the Smeltery.


This can be any size, up to 16x16x64, but it must be rectangular.


The basic standard Smeltery starts with a 3x3 base, usually in the ground. Then on the next layer, add Seared Bricks around the edges. At the front of the Smeltery, you'll place your Smeltery Controller and Seared Tank.


To pump molten ingots out, we'll need a Seared Drain to pour the molten metal into our Casting Table and Basin. Don't forget the Faucets!
chapter.22.quest.26.title: The Mighty Smeltery
chapter.22.quest.27.description.1: To learn more about creating a Smeltery, let's make the next book: Mighty Smelting
chapter.22.quest.27.subtitle: Taking the Training Wheels Off
chapter.22.quest.28.description.1: These blocks can be used as a replacement for Seared Bricks, while still making the Smeltery functional!
chapter.22.quest.28.title: Customizing your Smeltery
chapter.22.quest.29.description.1:
Aside from the Seared Drain, there are more ways to pump fluids and items into or out of your Smeltery.


The &9Seared Duct&r allows you to pump specific fluids out of your Smeltery. To do this, fill a Copper Can or Bucket filled with the fluid you wish to filter out, then put it inside of the Duct to act as a filter. This will then be shown in the middle of the Duct.


The &6Seared Chute&r allows you to pump items into the Smeltery.
chapter.22.quest.29.title: Input/Output
chapter.22.quest.3.description.1:
To start crafting custom tools, we'll need 2 things:


The &9Tinker Station&r, which is what we'll use to combine parts into tools. This is also where you'll repair, upgrade, and enchance your tools.


The &9Part Builder&r, which is what we'll use to create parts using &ePatterns&r and materials.


Note: If you place these beside each other, you can access them all from one block! This also works for other TC workbenches or anvils.
chapter.22.quest.30.description.1:
The Smeltery will combine molten ingots together to create &9Alloys&r. You'll figure this out really fast if you just pump random ores into it.


We will need alloys to create better tools and armor, so let's get ourselves some Bronze.


To get Bronze, smelt Copper and Tin together. The alloy is 3 parts Copper, 1 part Tin.


Tip: Pouring the molten Bronze into a Casting Basin creates a Bronze block, instead of making the individual ingots with the Casting Table.
chapter.22.quest.30.title: Making Alloys
chapter.22.quest.31.description.1:
The &6Tinker's Anvil&r is the upgrade to the Tinker Station.


It allows you to create &9Broad Tools&r like the Hammer, Excavator, and more.


Note: The anvil top can be made out of any alloy, not just Bronze.
chapter.22.quest.31.subtitle: The Ultimate Creation Table
chapter.22.quest.32.description.1:
If you want to increase the amount of storage and input slots the Smeltery has, build the Smeltery upwards!


Every layer on top of the Smeltery increases the amount of items it can smelt at the same time, and how much molten Ingots it can store.


The max height is 64.
chapter.22.quest.32.subtitle: Size Does Matter
chapter.22.quest.32.title: Increasing the Size
chapter.22.quest.33.description.1:
If you're new to TC, it's helpful to know each part of the Smeltery and how it functions.


The main controller, whether it is a &9Melter&r or &9Smeltery Controller&r will have a GUI when you right click. If it doesn't, the structure isn't complete!


This is how you manually insert ores and items into the Smeltery.
chapter.22.quest.33.task.1.title: Understanding Smeltery Parts
chapter.22.quest.34.description.1:
&9Casting Basins&r are used to create blocks out of molten metal. This is the easiest way to get metal out of the Smeltery, as it extracts 9 ingots to create a block. These can also be used to create specific items by pouring molten metals onto blocks placed in the Basin.


&9Casting Tables&r are used for more precise pours, like creating casts or tool parts.
chapter.22.quest.34.task.1.title: Casting Basin and Table
chapter.22.quest.35.description.1:
When right-clicked, &9Faucets&r function as a way to extract molten ingots from the Smeltery. This will only work if there is something to pour out onto, like a Casting Table.


&9Channels&r are used to extend the reach of a faucet, and create a pipe-like network for molten liquids.
chapter.22.quest.35.task.1.title: Faucets and Channels
chapter.22.quest.36.description.1:
&9Seared Fuel Tanks&r store liquids that are used to heat up the Smeltery to smelt items down. These can stack on top of each other within the Smeltery multi-block, and can hold 4 buckets of fuel.


Certain &eFuels&r are required to smelt certain ingots, depending on the heat required. Lava works for most ores, but you'll need &6Blazing Blood&r to smelt higher tier materials, like Allthemodium.
chapter.22.quest.36.task.1.title: Fuel Tanks and Fuels
chapter.22.quest.37.description.1:
The Smeltery can be used to smelt entities to create items.


&lNotable Entities:&r


Players - Blood (Slimeball substitute)
Silverfish - Seared Stone
Villagers and Illagers - Emeralds
Skeletons - Milk
Ender Dragon - What?
chapter.22.quest.37.subtitle: Don't Stand in the Smeltery
chapter.22.quest.37.title: Smelting Entities
chapter.22.quest.38.description.1:
Looking for a complete list of Materials, Upgrades, and more?


Make you one of these. It's better than having to flip through 4 different TC books.
chapter.22.quest.38.subtitle: The "All in One" Book
chapter.22.quest.39.description.1:
If we want to make a TC Foundry, we'll need something stronger than Seared Bricks.


Head to the Nether for Magma Cream and Soul Sand. You'll need these to craft you some &9Nether Grout&r.
chapter.22.quest.39.subtitle: I am Nether Grout.
chapter.22.quest.39.title: Nether Grout
chapter.22.quest.4.description.1: The Part Chest is used to store extra parts that you might need in the future.
chapter.22.quest.4.subtitle: Storing Parts
chapter.22.quest.40.description.1: This book contains all of the information needed to create and use a Foundry, as well as a list of Tier 4 Materials and how to create Plate Armor.
chapter.22.quest.40.subtitle: How-To Foundry
chapter.22.quest.41.description.1:
To create the Foundry, we'll need the &6Foundry Controller&r.


To get this, place a Scorched Brick in a Casting Basin, then pour at least 1 block's worth of Obsidian over it.
chapter.22.quest.41.title: Creating a Foundry Controller
chapter.22.quest.42.description.1: Smelting Nether Grout will give us &6Scorched Bricks&r, which is what we'll use to create our Foundry.
chapter.22.quest.42.title: Nether Smelting
chapter.22.quest.43.description.1:
The &6Foundry&r is just like the Smeltery, but doesn't create alloys. No more worrying about mixing materials!


The Foundry also creates &9Byproducts&r from items smelted. For example, Copper can give Gold as a byproduct.


To create the Foundry, you'll need to build it like the Smeltery using Scorched items instead of Seared. The Foundry also needs corners to function.


Here is an example of a complete Foundry:
chapter.22.quest.43.title: Creating the Foundry
chapter.22.quest.44.description.1: Just like the Smeltery, there are many blocks you can use that function as Foundry blocks when creating your Foundry.
chapter.22.quest.44.title: Customizing the Foundry
chapter.22.quest.45.description.1:
For those that want to create alloys, this block will do exactly that.


It will need either a heater or fuel tank beneath it, and will need Ingot tanks adjacent to the Alloyer to create the alloys.


Insert the molten ingots into each of the Ingot Tanks, and the Alloyer will create the alloy.
chapter.22.quest.45.subtitle: For Those That Need Alloys
chapter.22.quest.46.description.1:
Lava will not cut it for smelting down ores like &6Allthemodium&r. For this you'll need something hotter.


Stacy's Mo- I mean &6Blazing Blood&r.


There are several ways to get this. You can smelt Blaze Heads in the Foundry, OR... smelt the Blazes directly.


Tip: Use &9Mekanism's &eCardboard Box&r to pick up a Blaze Spawner in the Nether. Bring the Blazes to your Foundry!!!!
chapter.22.quest.46.subtitle: What in the Blazes
chapter.22.quest.46.title: &6Blazing Blood&r
chapter.22.quest.47.description.1:
Want to melt entities by hand?


Adding the &6Melter&r ability to your tool allows you to melt the enemies directly into your tool.


Note: The Tool will require a &9Tank Upgrade&r to store liquids.
chapter.22.quest.47.title: Melting Tool Ability
chapter.22.quest.5.description.1: The Tinker's Chest allows you to store even more parts!
chapter.22.quest.5.subtitle: Even More Storage
chapter.22.quest.52.description.1: High Damage weapon that also decapitates.
chapter.22.quest.52.subtitle: Heavy Hitter
chapter.22.quest.52.title: Cleaver
chapter.22.quest.53.subtitle: 3x3 Digging
chapter.22.quest.53.title: Excavator
chapter.22.quest.54.subtitle: Kinda useless with Ultimine
chapter.22.quest.54.title: Vein Hammer
chapter.22.quest.55.subtitle: 3x3 Mining
chapter.22.quest.55.title: Sledge Hammer
chapter.22.quest.56.subtitle: Cuts down entire trees - Also useless with Ultimine
chapter.22.quest.57.subtitle: Reaping Tool for Farming
chapter.22.quest.58.description.1:
Tools can be repaired by placing them in a Tinker Station with the material they are made out of.


You can also make repair kits (from Tinkers' Construct, not Silent Gear) to repair them on the go.


Tools can also be upgraded by combining the new tool part with the tool in the Tinker Station.
chapter.22.quest.58.task.1.title: Repairing and Upgrading Tools
chapter.22.quest.59.description.1:
Deep in The Other, you will find a Volcano filled with the hottest liquid in all of Minecraft.


&6Soul Lava&r is used to make the Allthemodium alloys. You'll need this to make the ATM Star!
chapter.22.quest.59.subtitle: So hot it can melt anything, except an Iron Bucket.
chapter.22.quest.59.title: &6Soul Lava
chapter.22.quest.6.description.1:
Take some blank patterns and place them inside of your Part Builder.


you'll place materials beside the pattern to create certain parts. Start by placing some cobble in to create yourself a &9Stone Pickaxe Head&r, &9Stone Tool Rod&r, and &9Stone Binding&r.


Note: Metals like Ingots will not work in this table. This is only for basic materials like wood, stone, etc.
chapter.22.quest.6.title: Creating Parts
chapter.22.quest.60.description.1:
With Soul Lava, you'll be able to create the Allthemodium alloys.


Note: You will need to use either an Alloyer or the Smeltery to combine the ingots, as the Foundry does not make alloys.
chapter.22.quest.60.title: The ATM Alloys
chapter.22.quest.61.description.1:
If you're just starting out, you can make yourself some &9Traveler's Gear&r.


These gear pieces all boast several upgrade slots, defense slots, and an ability slot.


While it isn't the greatest for protection, it allows you to customize your armor.
chapter.22.quest.61.task.1.title: Traveler's Gear
chapter.22.quest.62.description.1:
Using Cobalt from the Nether, you can create yourself a customizable set of &9Plate Armor&r.


This is basically an upgrade from the Traveler's Gear.


Each piece of Plate Armor has high durability and armor, and they all come with:


1 Upgrade Slot
4 Defense Slots
1 Ability Slot
chapter.22.quest.62.task.1.title: Plate Armor
chapter.22.quest.7.description.1:
With our parts in hand, let's jump over to the Tinker Station.


The Tinker Station is how we combine parts to make tools, as well as upgrading and repairing them.


Select the Pickaxe left side, and you'll see the 3 items needed to craft a pickaxe. Place in your parts, and you'll have created your first tool!
chapter.22.quest.7.title: Your First Tool
chapter.22.quest.8.description.1:
The Traveler's Goggles has low armor and durability, but it also comes with:


3 Upgrade Slots
2 Defense Slots
1 Ability Slot
chapter.22.quest.9.description.1:
The Traveler's Vest has low armor and durability, but has:


3 Upgrade Slots
2 Defense Slots
1 Ability Slot
chapter.22.title: Tinkers' Construct
chapter.3.quest.1.description.1:
Welcome to the &9Twilight Forest&r!


To create a portal to the Twilight Forest, make a 2x2 hole and fill it with water. Surround the edges of the hole with flowers, and throw a diamond in.


Thor will give you a sign if you did it right.
chapter.3.quest.1.subtitle: Creating the Portal
chapter.3.quest.1.task.1.title: Enter the Twilight Forest
chapter.3.quest.1.title: The Twilight Forest
chapter.3.quest.10.description.1:
The infamous multi-headed beast from Greek Mythology.


Ranged attacks aren't as effective, meaning you'll need to get up close and personal.


Once defeated, you'll be able to find the next boss in the Dark Forest.
chapter.3.quest.10.subtitle: Firey Swamp
chapter.3.quest.10.title: Hydra Slayer
chapter.3.quest.11.description.1:
Inside the Dark Forest, you'll find a structure that leads underground.


To enter, you'll need to place one of the trophies you've acquired on the nearby pedastal.


On the 3rd layer, you'll find the Knight Phantoms. Defeat these to unlock the next boss.
chapter.3.quest.11.subtitle: The Darkest of Forests
chapter.3.quest.11.title: Entering the Dark Forest
chapter.3.quest.12.description.1:
Within the Dark Forest, you'll find the Dark Tower.


To enter, look for the reappearing blocks at the base. Find your way through the maze all the way to the final floor to fight the Ur-Ghast.


The Ur-Ghast is recommended to kill with a ranged weapon. There are 4 Ghast traps found on boss floor, which can be used to damage the Ur-Ghast.


These are charged with Ghastling kills, then activating with redstone. You don't have to use them, but they can prove useful.
chapter.3.quest.12.subtitle: Dark Carmonite Tower
chapter.3.quest.12.title: Tears of Fire
chapter.3.quest.13.description.1:
After defeating the Ur-Ghast, you'll unlock the Snowy Forest biomes.


There are many creatures to fight, but to continue your progression, you'll need to kill the Alpha Yeti.


You can find the Alpha Yeti in a massive Yeti cave. Defeat it to move on.
chapter.3.quest.13.title: To the Snow Biomes!
chapter.3.quest.14.description.1:
Defeating the Alpha Yeti unlocks the Glacier biome. Here, you'll find cute little penguins and the Snow Queen.


At the top of the Aurora Palace, the Snow Queen will summon ice crystals to protect herself.


She'll also slam ice blocks down that destroys the floor and deals massive damage.


You'll only be able to hit her top half, as she's protected by ice blocks.


After defeating the Snow Queen, you'll unlock access to the Highlands.
chapter.3.quest.14.title: Clear Skies
chapter.3.quest.15.description.1:
With the Giant Pickaxe, you'll want to head back to Troll Caves to find Giant Obsidian.


Use the Giant Pickaxe to break it, and you'll find some loot. You want to get the Lamp of Cinders to continue.
chapter.3.quest.16.description.1:
With your Magic Beans and Uberous Soil, you'll want to look for a large cloud in the highland biomes.


Plant the magic beans in the soil to grow a beanstalk all the way up. Here, you'll find the Giants.


You'll need to kill the Miner Giant and get their pickaxe to continue on.
chapter.3.quest.16.subtitle: The giants look like me, but are nothing LIKE me.
chapter.3.quest.17.description.1: From the scales of the Naga, you can craft some armor. Not super strong, but looks nice.
chapter.3.quest.17.title: Naga Scale Armor
chapter.3.quest.18.description.1:
Do you want to be able to shoot Ender blasts like the Lich? This is the scepter for it.


To recharge, combine it with an Ender Pearl in a crafting table.
chapter.3.quest.19.description.1:
Using this Scepter, you can drain the life of your enemies!


To recharge the scepter, combine it with Fermented Spider Eyes in a crafting table.
chapter.3.quest.2.description.1:
In the Twilight Forest, there are a bunch of new entities to discover.


One of the worst is the Cicada. I suggest on killing this for the achievement, but killing any Twilight Forest mob will work.
chapter.3.quest.2.task.1.title: The Silence of the Forest
chapter.3.quest.20.description.1:
Because who doesn't want to summon their own Zombies?


To recharge, combine with Rotten Flesh in a crafting table.
chapter.3.quest.21.description.1:
This scepter summons shields around you for protection.


To recharge, combine with Golden Apples in a crafting table.
chapter.3.quest.22.description.1:
It's time to go to the swamps! In the swamps, you'll find an odd-looking hill with an entrance on top. This is the Minoshroom Labyrinth!


Inside, you'll fight several new enemies that can drop the Maze Map Focus. This is needed to make a Maze Map.


This is a special map that will map your way around the Minoshroom Labyrinth. Your minimap mod has no power here.


You can also find several loot rooms with special loot for the Maze!
chapter.3.quest.22.subtitle: I wonder if we'll find Shrek
chapter.3.quest.22.title: To the Swamps!
chapter.3.quest.23.description.1:
This map is a must have for the Twlight Forest.


Using a Blank Magic Map will give you a map that shows icons for nearby bosses and structures.
chapter.3.quest.24.description.1:
This is slightly stronger than Naga armor, and comes fully enchanted.


You can make these by finding &6Steeleaf&r within the Twilight Forest.
chapter.3.quest.24.title: Steeleaf Armor
chapter.3.quest.25.description.1:
This armor can be crafted using &9Ironwood&r.


This armor comes automatically enchanted as well.
chapter.3.quest.25.title: Ironwood Armor
chapter.3.quest.26.description.1:
The Hyrda drops Fiery Blood that can be used to craft Fiery armor.


When wearing the full set, enemies that attack you will be set on fire for 10 seconds.
chapter.3.quest.26.title: Fiery Armor
chapter.3.quest.27.description.1: Chance of being found in Phantom Knight chests.
chapter.3.quest.28.description.1: Crafted or found in the Phantom Knight's chests.
chapter.3.quest.28.title: Knightmetal Armor
chapter.3.quest.29.description.1:
Find the Questing Ram, for it bestows wealth to those who give it Rainbow Wool (16 colors)


Hint: There's a dispenser above your head in the ruins where the Ram is. It might prove useful.
chapter.3.quest.29.title: Ramification
chapter.3.quest.3.description.1:
.... is not yet implemented.


Instead, head to the giant castle in the Final Plateau and grab some door blocks!


There is a kobold that spawns in as a "placeholder" but you will get nothing from killing it.
chapter.3.quest.3.task.1.title: Enter the Final Plateau
chapter.3.quest.3.title: The Final Boss
chapter.3.quest.30.description.1:
This is a single-use item that will prevent death. Instead of dying, the charm will be consumed and you'll be given health regen for a short period of time.


These are found in loot chests.
chapter.3.quest.31.description.1: Just like the Charm of Life I, this item is consumed to prevent your death. When consumed, you'll regen all of your health and be given Regen IV, Resistance, and Fire Resistance for 30 seconds.
chapter.3.quest.32.description.1: This item will prevent you from losing the items in your held items and armor when you die.
chapter.3.quest.33.description.1: This item will let you keep your armor and hotbar when you die.
chapter.3.quest.34.description.1: This item will let you keep all of your items in your inventory when you die.
chapter.3.quest.35.subtitle: A Glorified Leafblower
chapter.3.quest.36.title: Yeti Armor
chapter.3.quest.37.description.1: Small Yetis and Winter Wolves drop fur to make this armor.
chapter.3.quest.37.subtitle: Dyable!
chapter.3.quest.37.title: Arctic Armor
chapter.3.quest.38.description.1:
A special pickaxe rarely found in Labyrinths.


This pick will take 1 damage when breaking Maze walls, instead of the 16 damage for all other picks!
chapter.3.quest.38.subtitle: Trapped chamber, do not enter?
chapter.3.quest.39.description.1: Dropped from the Snow Queen, this bow shoots 3 arrows at the same time, while only using 1.
chapter.3.quest.4.description.1:
There are a lot of different foods you can make from the Twilight Forest!


Try them all!
chapter.3.quest.4.title: Fancy Noms
chapter.3.quest.40.description.1: Dropped from the Snow Queen, this bow will shoot arrows that home in on your targets. No more missing!
chapter.3.quest.41.description.1: Found randomly in loot chests, this bow will inflict Slowness III for 10 seconds on hit.
chapter.3.quest.42.description.1:
This bow is rarely found in the Aurora Palace.


When an enemy is hit from this bow, you will swap places with them. Be careful shooting things out of the sky!
chapter.3.quest.43.description.1:
A Magnet that can pull up anything with Ore in name, except Coal.


This is found in Hollow Hill chests.
chapter.3.quest.44.description.1:
A sword that deals 40 hearts of damage, but only has 1 durability.


You can make this indestructible if you want to use this.


These are rarely found in loot chests in the Aurora Palace.
chapter.3.quest.45.description.1: Found in the Aurora Palace, this sword will give enemies Frosted for 10 seconds when attacked.
chapter.3.quest.46.description.1:
This item is like a torch launcher. It launches &6Moonworms&r at the targeted block, which light up the block similar to a torch.


You can find this in Hollow Hill treasure chests.
chapter.3.quest.47.description.1:
Want to make the Overworld feel more like the Twilight Forest?


You can use this powder on Overworld animals to convert them into their Twilight Forest variants.


You can find this in dungeon chests in the Twilight Forest.
chapter.3.quest.49.description.1: Combining a Raven Feather with Torchberries and Glowstone will give you a Magic Map Focus.
chapter.3.quest.5.description.1:
It's easy to get lost in the Forest. In your travels, you'll run into Obsidian pillars.


These pillars will have Ravens around them. Slay them to get their feathers, which you can use to create a map for the Twilight Forest!
chapter.3.quest.5.title: Raven Feathers
chapter.3.quest.50.description.1:
Using the Fiery Blood from the Hydra, you can make several tools.


The Fiery Sword comes with Fire Aspect II when crafted.


The Fiery Pickaxe comes with auto-smelt.
chapter.3.quest.51.description.1: This is a drop from the Minoshroom. It deals more damage when sprinting.
chapter.3.quest.52.title: Knightmetal Tools
chapter.3.quest.53.description.1:
&9Reappearing Blocks&r are like really cool doors. Once right-clicked, they'll disappear for a short time.


The &6Vanishing Blocks&r will disappear when right-clicked, but they don't come back.
chapter.3.quest.54.description.1:
The &9Carminite Builder&r, when powered with a redstone signal, will generate temporary blocks in the direction the signal came from.


The &6Carminite Reactor&r will convert nearby Obsidian and Netherack into False Gold and False Diamond. After a short period of time, this will suck up nearby blocks and explode, creating Carminite Ghastlings around it.
chapter.3.quest.55.description.1:
Once you've unlocked the Highland biome, head over and find some trolls to kill.


They can drop some &9Magic Beans&r. You'll also find chests that give you Uberus Soil, which is needed to grow the beans.
chapter.3.quest.55.title: Visiting the Giants
chapter.3.quest.56.description.1:
Using the Lamp of Cinders, you will now be able to break the thorns in the Thornland Biome.


Gather some Thorn Roses to continue on to the Final Plateau.
chapter.3.quest.56.title: Every Thorn has its Rose
chapter.3.quest.6.description.1:
Within the Twilight Forest, there are loot chests that can give you rare saplings.


Collect them all!
chapter.3.quest.6.subtitle: Growing Trees
chapter.3.quest.6.title: The Real Final Boss
chapter.3.quest.7.description.1:
The first boss on your Twilight adventure can be found within the Courtyard.


Killing the Naga will grant entry to the next boss, the Lich.
chapter.3.quest.7.title: Time to Even the Scales
chapter.3.quest.8.description.1:
Within his tower, a Lich of great power lives here.


It is a 3 phase fight, but only 1 phase is unique.


Phase 1: The Lich surrounds himself in shields, and attacks you with Ender Pearls that shoot out like Ghast fireballs. Reflect these back to the Lich to break his shields! As his shields break, he'll send out duplicates to distract you.


Phase 2: The Lich switches scepters to summon Zombies to help him in the fight. With his defenses down, you will be able to melee him!


Phase 3: Once all of the charges are spent on his Scepter, he will switch to a Golden Sword and go berserk. Kill him fast!
chapter.3.quest.8.title: Bring out your Dead
chapter.3.quest.9.description.1:
In the depths of the Labyrinth Swamp is a giant Minoshroom.


Once defeated, it'll drop Meef Stroganoff. To unlock the next area, you must eat it.
chapter.3.quest.9.title: Mighty Stroganoff

chapter.5.quest.1.subtitle: Can be used as Reactor Coolant

chapter.5.quest.10.subtitle: And Other Useful Items!

chapter.5.quest.11.subtitle: A Simple Magnet!
chapter.5.quest.12.description.1:
The rending gale if you are unfamiliar is a method of creative flight! it requires small amounts of emc to run


For EMC before a transmutation table, we recommend redstone/glowstone, or a klein star which is the battery of this mod, you can fill these in a projectE relay!
chapter.5.quest.2.description.1: Use this item to shrink. Helpful for working on automation and also just overall fun.
chapter.5.quest.2.subtitle: Honey I Shrunk Myself
chapter.5.quest.3.description.1: This potion will allow you to see the respective ore through the walls.
chapter.5.quest.3.subtitle: It's like X-Ray Vision!
chapter.5.quest.3.task.1.title: IronSight
chapter.5.quest.3.title: OreSight Potions
chapter.5.quest.4.description.1:
It's an entire room in one block!


Higher tiers are even bigger on the inside.
chapter.5.quest.4.subtitle: When an infinite world is too small
chapter.5.quest.5.description.1: This item is serves as the guide for Compact Machines, as well as the tool needed to teleport into your tiny machine worlds.
chapter.5.quest.5.title: Compact Machines
chapter.5.quest.6.description.1:
Some useful gadgets for building.


&cDestruction Gadget voids blocks!
chapter.5.quest.6.title: Building Gadgets
chapter.5.quest.7.description.1:
Can be helpful for building.


The consruction wand has cores that can be added to it in crafting. Sneak left-click the air to switch between cores.
chapter.5.quest.7.title: Building Wands
chapter.5.quest.8.subtitle: Complete all of the tips!
chapter.5.quest.8.title: Tipped Out
chapter.5.quest.9.description.1:
OreSight Potions can be used to craft Charms!


Charms are Curios that last longer, and can be toggled on and off.
chapter.5.quest.9.task.1.title: Charm of IronSight
chapter.5.quest.9.title: X-Ray Charms

Here you'll find all of the rewards you can get by slaying enemies.

The philosopher's stone projectile keybind can turn mobs into others with either a klein star or a little redstone in your inventory, but be careful, testing this I died to an evoker, and lost my chests to a ghast...
Also, take a free phantom charm, being a skyblock I think you will thank me for this one
